intro: Anaphalis surculosa, commonly known as the woolly cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, white, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance, and its flowers are typically small and clustered. It thrives in alpine and arctic environments, preferring well-drained soils and cool climates. Anaphalis surculosa is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
